node.title: Revenue of $16m for Ashburton District Council â€“ annual report forecasts
node.description: The Ashburton District Council believes it is fiscally well placed after its operating budgets has it well in the black.
node.content:
["The Ashburton District Council believes it is fiscally well placed after its operating budgets has it well in the black.", "", "
Ashburton District Council offices. Photo: Ashburton District Council
", "Council adopted its 200-page plus annual report for the year at its final council meeting before the Christmas and New Year break, which confirmed returns of $16 million over its $88m budget for the year.", "Most of the extra revenue was due to unbudgeted grants of $8m alongside $6.5m from revaluations, forest property, and swaps.", "The report states that the council's financial performance in 2021/22 "has seen us meet the goals of our financial strategy which focuses on prudence, stability, service and planning for the future".", ""Council has also met nine of the ten goals of the government's mandatory financial affordability performance benchmarks."", "More than $38.2m was generated from rates, about $835,000 more than the previous financial year.", "Rates revenue has increased by about $6.4m over the past five years.", "Staff costs stretched out to more than $16.6m, an increase of about $537,000 in 12 months.", "There is currently 251 staff employed by council, including 196 full-time employees.", "However, roading and transportation continues to be a significant hurdle for council with a lukewarm response from mid Cantabrians.", "A recorded 38 percent of residents were satisfied with sealed roads and a little over half of surveyed residents were satisfied with unsealed roads.", "For the year ending 30 June, council completed 6200 km of grading on unsealed roads, resealed 87 km of road and filled more than 3600 potholes.", "The impact of Covid-19 lockdowns was outlined in the report by council with more than $400,000 additional payments made to contractors due to delays on capital projects.", "Last year's lockdowns caused a decrease of $423,000 in revenue for the EA Networks Centre for the year ending 30 June 2020 with more of the same noted following the measuring period.", ""The numbers coming into the EA Networks Centre post balance date have not completely returned to the pre-Covid-19 levels."", "The report received a last minute seal of approval from Audit New Zealand.", "", "Local Democracy Reporting is a public interest news service supported by RNZ, the News Publishers' Association and NZ On Air."]
